description: From Middle English frozen, frosen, ifrozen, variant of froren, ifroren ("frozen"; > see frorn), past participle of Middle English fresen, freosen (“to freeze”). Synchronically, freeze +‎ -n.

adjectives.description: frozen (comparative more frozen, superlative most frozen)

entries.meaning: Having undergone the process of freezing; in ice form.
examples: The mammoth has been frozen for ten thousand years.
I just stood frozen as the robber pointed at me with his gun.

entries.meaning: (of a bank account or assets) In a state such that transactions are not allowed.
(grammar) Retaining an older, obsolete syntax of an earlier version of a language, which now operates only on a specific word or phrase.

examples: The mammoth was frozen shortly after death.
